unnormalised: ## Payment Gateways: Your Digital Dukaandar's Best Friend (and Least Favorite Headache)
normalised: ## Payment Gateways: Your Digital Shopkeeper's Best Friend (and Least Favorite Headache)

unnormalised: So, you've finally built your online empire selling handloom sarees from Kanchipuram. Congrats, bhai! But hold on, before you start picturing yourself swimming in Rs. 500 notes like Scrooge McDuck, let's talk about something crucial: payment gateways.

unnormalised: Think of payment gateways as the cashier at your digital dukaandar (shop). They're the unsung heroes (or villains, depending on the day) that handle all the money shenanigans when Mrs. Sharma from Delhi decides she absolutely *needs* that magenta silk saree you're selling for Rs. 3,500.

unnormalised: Without a payment gateway, you're basically asking your customers to courier you cash or, worse, rely on the "bank transfer" method which involves more screenshots than a Bollywood film's climax sequence. No one has time for that, especially not during Onam shopping frenzy!

unnormalised: Choosing the right gateway is like finding the perfect biryani recipe – everyone has their own opinion, and the consequences of getting it wrong can be...explosive. There's Razorpay, Instamojo, PayU... a whole army of them, each promising lightning-fast transactions and iron-clad security.

unnormalised: But here's the truth: they all have their quirks. Some charge higher transaction fees (think of it as the masala tax!), others have clunkier interfaces that make you want to pull your hair out. And then there's the dreaded "technical glitch" that mysteriously appears just when you're expecting a massive surge in orders because Deepika Padukone wore your saree to some film premiere.
